name: inconformity
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal the quality of being different from other things or people: WTO members are anxious to avoid inconformity with international standards. This inconformity makes it difficult to compare the two measures. Compare
nonconformity
religion
  specialized the practice of belonging to a Christian group that is Protestant but does not belong to the Church of England: Clergy who lost their jobs sometimes did so for financial reasons rather than inconformity. Synonym
nonconformity
More examplesFewer examplesThe company should be held liable for any loss caused by inconformity with the regulations. Even though the treatment has been used widely, inconformity of dose is still problematic.He alone of all the bishops could no longer endure unyielding inconformity.
